ingredients: 2 medium onions (finely sliced and fried until golden - birista)
Water (as needed for boiling rice and cooking meat)
Aluminum foil and dough (to seal the pot for dum cooking)

steps.title: Marinate the Mutton - Step 1
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, salt, cardamom powder, and nutmeg-mace powder.

steps.title: Marinate the Mutton - Step 2
steps.description: Add half of the fried onions (birista) to the yogurt mixture and mix well.

steps.title: Marinate the Mutton - Step 3
steps.description: Add the mutton pieces and coat them thoroughly with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.

steps.title: Prepare Saffron Milk - Step 1
steps.description: Soak saffron strands in warm milk for 10–15 minutes to release color and aroma.

steps.title: Prepare Saffron Milk - Step 2
steps.description: Add rose water and kewra water to the saffron milk. Mix gently and set aside.

steps.title: Boil the Rice - Step 1
steps.description: Rinse basmati rice thoroughly until the water runs clear. Soak in water for 30 minutes, then drain.

steps.title: Boil the Rice - Step 2
steps.description: In a large vessel, bring ample water to a boil. Add bay leaves, cinnamon stick, green cardamoms, cloves, star anise, black cumin seeds, and salt.

steps.title: Boil the Rice - Step 3
steps.description: Add the soaked rice to the boiling water and cook until the grains are about 70% done—firm with a slight bite.

steps.title: Boil the Rice - Step 4
steps.description: Drain the rice immediately to prevent overcooking and spread it out to cool slightly.

steps.title: Layering the Biryani - Step 1
steps.description: In a heavy-bottomed pot or handi, grease the base with ghee.

steps.title: Layering the Biryani - Step 2
steps.description: Spread the marinated mutton evenly on the bottom as the first layer.

steps.title: Layering the Biryani - Step 3
steps.description: Add a layer of the partially cooked rice over the mutton.

steps.title: Layering the Biryani - Step 4
steps.description: Sprinkle the remaining fried onions, chopped mint, and coriander leaves on top.

steps.title: Layering the Biryani - Step 5
steps.description: Drizzle the prepared saffron milk evenly over the top rice layer.

steps.title: Seal and Cook on Dum - Step 1
steps.description: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid or aluminum foil to trap steam.

steps.title: Seal and Cook on Dum - Step 2
steps.description: Seal the edges with kneaded dough if using a traditional lid, to ensure no steam escapes.

steps.title: Seal and Cook on Dum - Step 3
steps.description: Place the sealed pot on a low flame or a griddle (tava) to prevent direct heat and cook for 45–60 minutes.

steps.title: Rest and Serve - Step 1
steps.description: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest undisturbed for 10–15 minutes to allow the flavors to settle.

steps.title: Rest and Serve - Step 2
steps.description: Carefully open the seal, gently fluff the rice using a flat spoon, and serve hot with raita or salan.
